chapter.title: Chapter Sixteen
chapter.subtitle: Daivasura-sampad-vibhagayoga
chapter.description: In the sixteenth chapter the teaching of Daivasura-sampada-vibhagayoga is given. In this chapter Lord Krishna describes the characteristics of divine and demonic wealth.

dedication.meaning: I serve the lotus feet of the fearless one, who gives joy to the devotees

verses.Language:

Danang Damshcha Yajnashcha Swadhyayastap Arjavam..1..
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said - O India! Fearlessness, purity of being, practice of transcendental knowledge, charity, self-restraint, performing sacrifices, study of Vedic scriptures, penance, simplicity.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Ahimsa Satyamkrodhastyaga: Shantirpaishunam.
Daya Bhuteshbaloluptwang Mardbong Hreerchapalam..2..
verses.translation: Non-violence, truthfulness, non-anger, dispassion, peace, not looking at the faults of others, kindness to all living beings, greedlessness, gentleness, shyness, non-violence.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Tej: Kshama Dhriti: Shouchamdroho Natimanita.
Bhavanti Sadhadang Daivimabhijatsya Bharat. 3.
verses.translation: Radiance, forgiveness, patience, abstinence, masarya emptiness, pridelessness - all these qualities are seen in persons with Divyabhava.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Dambho darpohvimanashcha krodha: parushyameva f.

verses.translation: O Parth! Arrogance, arrogance, arrogance, anger, harshness and indiscretion - all these wealth are gained by demonic minded people.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
According to the Asuri Mata, the registration of divine resources.

verses.translation: Divine wealth is considered conducive to liberation, while demonic wealth is considered binding. O son of Pandu! Do not mourn, for you are born with divine wealth.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Dau bhootsargau lokesamin daiva asur and f.
Daibo vastarsh prokta asurang partha me srinu..6..
verses.translation: O Parth! In this world, two types of beings - Devas and Asurics - have been created. Deity is explained in detail. Now hear from me about the nature of demons.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Prakrting f Nikrting f Jana na Vidurasura:
No Shauchong Napi Chacharo or Satyang Teshu Vidyate..7..
verses.translation: Asurasvabhava persons are devoted to religious matters and do not know how to abstain from non-religious matters. Ablution, morality and truthfulness do not exist among them.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Jagdahuraniswaram at Astyamapratisthanga.
8.
verses.translation: People of demonic nature say that this world is false, hopeless and godless. This world has arisen due to kamma and there is no other cause than kamma.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Etang Drishtimbashtabhya Nastatmanolipbuddhaya:
Prabhavantyugrakarman: Kshaya Jagatohita: ..9..
verses.translation: Adopting this type of decision, the Asuras who do not have knowledge of Atmatattva, have little intelligence, are fierce and mischievous, exert their influence in the work of destroying the world.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Kammashritya Duspurang Dambhanamdanvita:
10.
verses.translation: Those demonic persons harboring lustful lusts, being proud, proud and intoxicated with alcohol, commit themselves to impure deeds and engage in immoral activities through infatuation.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Chintamparimeyang c Pralayantamupasrita:
11.
verses.translation: Taking shelter of immeasurable anxiety, they consider sensual enjoyment till death as the ultimate goal of their life.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Ashapasashatairvadha: Kamakrodhaparayana:
12.
verses.translation: In this way, hundreds of people, bound by hope and driven by lust and anger, try to accumulate money by dishonest means for the enjoyment of lust.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Idamdya maya labdhamimang prapsye manoratham.
13.
verses.translation: Asurasvabhava persons think- 'Today I have made so much profit and according to my plan more profit will come. Now I have so much wealth and will gain more wealth in the future.'
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:

Ishwarohhamhang Bhogi Siddhohhang Balban Sukhi..14..
verses.translation: 'That enemy has been killed by me and I will kill other enemies also. I am God, I am the consumer. I am perfect, strong and happy.'
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.translation: 'I am surrounded by the richest and most aristocratic relatives. There is no one else like me. I will perform sacrifices, give alms and rejoice.' This is how Asurasvabhava persons are deluded by ignorance.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.translation: Bewildered by various worries and entangled in delusions, those addicted to lust fall into the impure hell.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Atmasambhavita: Stavdha Dhanamanamdanvita:
17.
verses.translation: Those self-proud, humble and exalted persons of wealth and means perform nominal Yajnas with inordinate pomp.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Ahankarang balang darpong kamang krodhang cha samshrita.

verses.translation: The Asuras harboring pride, force, lust, lust and anger hate Me as the Supreme Personality of Godhead in their own bodies and external bodies and accuse the virtues of saints.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.translation: Those haters, Kruras and Naradhams I continue to throw into the evil demon's vagina in this world.
verses.speaker: the supreme

20
verses.translation: O Kaunteya! Having attained Asurayoni birth after birth, those foolish persons are unable to attain Me and attain even worse speed.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Trividhang Naraksyedang Dwarang Nashanmatman:
Kama: krodhasthatha lovastsmadetattrayang tyajet..21..
verses.translation: Lust, anger and greed - these three are the gates of hell, so abandon those three.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:

Acharatyatman: Shreyasto jati parang gatim..22..
verses.translation: O Kaunteya! Being freed from these three types of tamodvara, man behaves in the best way of the soul and thereby attains perfection.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Yah Shastravidhimutsrajya varte kamakaratah.
Na sa siddhimbapnoti na sukhang na parang gatim..23..
verses.translation: One who abandons the Shastravidhi and remains present in Kamachar, cannot attain siddhi, happiness or perfection.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Tasmachchastrang Pratunang te Karkyakaryavashitou.
Jnatva Shastrabidhanoktang Karma Kartumiharhasi..24..
verses.translation: Therefore, scriptures are your proof in determining duty and non-duty. Therefore, knowing that action is said in the scriptures, you are qualified to do that action.
verses.speaker: the supreme

summary.title: Sixteenth Chapter - Daivasura-sampad-vibhagayoga
summary.description: In this chapter Lord Krishna describes in detail the characteristics of divine and demonic wealth. He explains that divine wealth is conducive to liberation, while demonic wealth is the cause of bondage. Divine qualities include fearlessness, purity of being, knowledge, charity, self-restraint, yajna, self-restraint, austerity, non-violence, truthfulness, forgiveness, patience etc. On the other hand, demonic qualities include pride, arrogance, arrogance, anger, cruelty, ignorance etc. Bhagavan also says that Lust, Anger and Greed are the three gates of hell and by abandoning them one can attain Paragati by behaving well in the soul.
keyThemes: Difference between divine and demonic nature
Harmful effects of lust, anger and greed
Importance of Shastravidhi and the need to follow it
Thoughts and actions of demonic persons
